str2: From hos with the directive enclitic of source; from which place or source or cause.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
To make like, liken; I compare. From homoios; to assimilate, i.e. Compare; passively, to become similar.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Full of pity, merciful, compassionate. From eleeo; compassionate.
And, even, also, namely.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) To have mercy on, show favor to, (b) trans. with object of sins: To forgive, pardon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hamartano; a sin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
